problems.solution: Apply Modus Ponens: from "P → Q" and "P", conclude "Q".
Apply Simplification to extract the left conjunct "P" from "P ∧ Q".
Apply Modus Tollens: from "P → Q" and "¬Q", conclude "¬P".
Apply Disjunctive Syllogism: from "P ∨ Q" and "¬P", conclude "Q".
Apply Double Negation elimination to remove "¬¬" and get "P".
Apply Conjunction to combine "P" and "Q" into "P ∧ Q".
Apply Simplification to extract the right conjunct "S" from "R ∧ S".
Apply De Morgan's Law to transform "¬(P ∧ Q)" into "¬P ∨ ¬Q".
Apply De Morgan's Law to transform "¬(P ∨ Q)" into "¬P ∧ ¬Q".
Apply Disjunctive Syllogism: from "Q ∨ R" and "¬Q", conclude "R".
Apply Commutativity to reorder the conjuncts: "P ∧ Q" is equivalent to "Q ∧ P".
Apply Commutativity to reorder the disjuncts: "P ∨ Q" is equivalent to "Q ∨ P".
Apply Idempotent law: "P ∧ P" simplifies to just "P".
Apply Idempotent law: "R ∨ R" simplifies to just "R".
Apply Addition: from "P", you can conclude "P ∨ Q" since P being true makes the disjunction true.
Apply Addition: from "R", you can conclude "R ∨ S" since R being true makes the disjunction true.
Apply Absorption law: "P ∨ (P ∧ Q)" simplifies to "P" since if P is true, the whole expression is true regardless of Q.
Apply Absorption law: "R ∧ (R ∨ S)" simplifies to "R" since R must be true for the whole expression to be true.
Apply Modus Ponens: from "S → T" and "S", conclude "T".
Apply Modus Tollens: from "R → S" and "¬S", conclude "¬R".
